qas.question: In what modern country is Avicenna considered an icon?
Where is a monument located that honors Avicenna?
Where is the Avicenna Mausoleum and Museum located?
In what European school does Avicenna's portrait hang in their hall of medicine?
What plant genus is named after Avicenna?
In what ancient country is Avicenna considered an icon?
Where is a monument located that dishonors Avicenna?
Where is the Avicenna Mausoleum and Museum not located?
In what European hospital does Avicenna's portrait hang in their hall of medicine?
What plant genus is not named after Avicenna?

context: In modern <a0_0><b5_0>Iran<b5_0/><a0_0/>, he is considered a national icon, and is often regarded as one of the greatest Persians to have ever lived. A monument was erected outside <a1_0><b6_0>the Bukhara museum<b6_0/><a1_0/>[year needed]. The Avicenna Mausoleum and Museum in <a2_0><b7_0>Hamadan<b7_0/><a2_0/> was built in 1952. Bu-Ali Sina University in Hamadan (Iran), Avicenna Research Institute in Tehran (Iran), the ibn Sīnā Tajik State Medical University in Dushanbe, Ibn Sina Academy of Medieval Medicine and Sciences at Aligarh, India, Avicenna School in Karachi and Avicenna Medical College in Lahore, Pakistan Ibne Sina Balkh Medical School in his native province of Balkh in Afghanistan, Ibni Sina Faculty Of Medicine of Ankara University Ankara, Turkey and Ibn Sina Integrated School in Marawi City (Philippines) are all named in his honour. His portrait hangs in the Hall of the <b8_0>Avicenna<b8_0/> Faculty of Medicine in <a3_0>the University of Paris<a3_0/>. There is also a crater on the Moon named Avicenna and a plant genus <a4_0><b9_0>Avicennia<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
